alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 12 at 6:14PM EDT until September 12 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Forsyth County in central North Carolina... Northeastern Davidson County in central North Carolina... West central Guilford County in central North Carolina... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 613 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Thomasville, or 9 miles north of Lexington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Winston-Salem, High Point, Lexington, Thomasville, Kernersville, Walkertown, Arcadia, Welcome and Sedge Garden. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
